word_letter_focus.title: Grammar: Appositives
word_letter_focus.directions: Read each sentence. Highlight each word in the nonessential appositive. Underline each word in the essential appositive.

sentence.text: The koala is a marsupial, {wh}a mammal that raises its young in a pouch{/wh}.
This mammal is only found in Australia, {wh}the smallest continent{/wh}, and its surrounding islands.
A joey, {wh}a baby koala{/wh}, lives in its mother’s pouch for the first six months of life.
The dingo, {wh}a wild Australian dog{/wh}, preys on koalas and eats them.
There are six species, {wh}scientific kinds{/wh}, of skunks in North America.
The striped skunk, {wh}the most common species in the United States{/wh}, has white stripes and black fur.
The spotted skunks, {wh}the smallest skunks{/wh}, have white spots instead of stripes.
My teacher {wu}Miss Brownlie{/wu} saw a hooded skunk in Costa Rica.
Dr. Rodriguez, {wh}our dentist{/wh}, opened a new office.
My brother {wu}Ray{/wu} just went for his dental checkup.
Miss Levin, {wh}the dental hygienist{/wh}, cleaned Ray’s teeth.
Then Dr. Rodriguez checked his teeth for caries, {wh}cavities{/wh}.
Our teacher {wu}Miss Tipton{/wu} makes literature exciting.
We are reading Hamlet, {wh}a play by William Shakespeare{/wh}, in class.

My friend {wu}Daniel{/wu} read the part of Hamlet.

The first prize is money({wh}$50{/wh}) that goes to the winner.
